column4: Isn't there a way I can add a line to the repos for it to check for program updates when it is released (like I remember reading something similar for WINE ) ?
you can install a cron job
how do i install cron job? and what'll it do?
cron job is a meta facility to program your computer to do certain things on a fixed time. like a sceduler-calender program
umm.. I'm not sure if cron job can help me update some of my preferred applications automatically. can it??
not by itself. you would have to program it to call the update-manager program with the interval you choose (2 sec, 1 day, very flexible)
but can it update manually installed programs also like openoffice Pidgin etc?
manually installed programs - no. thats a limitation of the update manager. it only watches for debs designed for ubuntu
even if I had used "checkinstall" option when manually installing?
which program are you talking about exactly?
sorry, which packet-manager-program are you talking about exactly?
u mean synaptic package manager (that's what I use)

i cant find this option in the manpage and via ./program --help. generally: i recommend just sticking with the debian repos. they also provide fast updates. other then that you would have to use a different distro, which will not be as comfortable as ubuntu regarding user experience
hmm.. ok. well thanks for your efforts; will then stick to manual updates for now I guess , if necessary .
sorry, i meant stick with the ubuntu repos
